content.raw: I don't think is possible. As far as I know the old/new values passed in to `std::replace` need to be of the same type and that type has to be the element stored in each element of the container. For `std::string` the element stored in each container cell is a `char`, so we could do something like `std::replace(package.begin(), package.end(), '.', ':')` but this is not what we want.
content.html: I don't think is possible. As far as I know the old/new values passed in to std::replace need to be of the same type and that type has to be the element stored in each element of the container. For std::string the element stored in each container cell is a char, so we could do something like std::replace(package.begin(), package.end(), '.', ':') but this is not what we want.
